eeprom.c

00001 // This file has been prepared for Doxygen automatic documentation generation.
00002 /*! \file ********************************************************************
00003 *
00004 * Atmel Corporation
00005 *
00006 * \li File:               eeprom.c
00007 * \li Compiler:           IAR EWAAVR 3.10c
00008 * \li Support mail:       avr@atmel.com
00009 *
00010 * \li Supported devices:  All devices with split EEPROM erase/write
00011 *                         capabilities can be used.
00012 *                         The example is written for ATmega48.
00013 *
00014 * \li AppNote:            AVR103 - Using the EEPROM Programming Modes.
00015 *
00016 * \li Description:        Example on how to use the split EEPROM erase/write
00017 *                         capabilities in e.g. ATmega48. All EEPROM
00018 *                         programming modes are tested, i.e. Erase+Write,
00019 *                         Erase-only and Write-only.
00020 *
00021 *                         $Revision: 1.6 $
00022 *                         $Date: Friday, February 11, 2005 07:16:44 UTC $
00023 ****************************************************************************/
00024 #include <avr/io.h>
00025 #include <avr/interrupt.h>
00026 
00027 /* These EEPROM bits have different names on different devices. */
00028 #ifndef EEPE
00029   #define EEPE  EEWE  //!< EEPROM program/write enable.
00030   #define EEMPE EEMWE //!< EEPROM master program/write enable.
00031 #endif
00032 
00033 /* These two are unfortunately not defined in the device include files. */
00034 #define EEPM1 5 //!< EEPROM Programming Mode Bit 1.
00035 #define EEPM0 4 //!< EEPROM Programming Mode Bit 0.
00036 
00037 /* Define to reduce code size. */
00038 #define EEPROM_IGNORE_SELFPROG //!< Remove SPM flag polling.
00039 
00040 /*! \brief  Read byte from EEPROM.
00041  *
00042  *  This function reads one byte from a given EEPROM address.
00043  *
00044  *  \note  The CPU is halted for 4 clock cycles during EEPROM read.
00045  *
00046  *  \param  addr  EEPROM address to read from.
00047  *  \return  The byte read from the EEPROM address.
00048  */
00049 unsigned char eeprom_get_char( unsigned int addr )
00050 {
00051  do {} while( EECR & (1<<EEPE) ); // Wait for completion of previous write.
00052  EEAR = addr; // Set EEPROM address register.
00053  EECR = (1<<EERE); // Start EEPROM read operation.
00054  return EEDR; // Return the byte read from EEPROM.
00055 }
00056 
00057 /*! \brief  Write byte to EEPROM.
00058  *
00059  *  This function writes one byte to a given EEPROM address.
00060  *  The differences between the existing byte and the new value is used
00061  *  to select the most efficient EEPROM programming mode.
00062  *
00063  *  \note  The CPU is halted for 2 clock cycles during EEPROM programming.
00064  *
00065  *  \note  When this function returns, the new EEPROM value is not available
00066  *         until the EEPROM programming time has passed. The EEPE bit in EECR
00067  *         should be polled to check whether the programming is finished.
00068  *
00069  *  \note  The EEPROM_GetChar() function checks the EEPE bit automatically.
00070  *
00071  *  \param  addr  EEPROM address to write to.
00072  *  \param  new_value  New EEPROM value.
00073  */
00074 ///void eeprom_put_char( unsigned int addr, unsigned char new_value )
00075 void eeprom_put_char( unsigned int addr, char new_value )
00076 {
00077  char old_value; // Old EEPROM value.
00078  char diff_mask; // Difference mask, i.e. old value XOR new value.
00079 
00080  cli(); // Ensure atomic operation for the write operation.
00081 
00082  do {} while( EECR & (1<<EEPE) ); // Wait for completion of previous write.
00083  #ifndef EEPROM_IGNORE_SELFPROG
00084  do {} while( SPMCSR & (1<<SELFPRGEN) ); // Wait for completion of SPM.
00085  #endif
00086 
00087  EEAR = addr; // Set EEPROM address register.
00088  EECR = (1<<EERE); // Start EEPROM read operation.
00089  old_value = EEDR; // Get old EEPROM value.
00090  diff_mask = old_value ^ new_value; // Get bit differences.
00091 
00092  // Check if any bits are changed to '1' in the new value.
00093  if( diff_mask & new_value ) {
00094   // Now we know that _some_ bits need to be erased to '1'.
00095 
00096   // Check if any bits in the new value are '0'.
00097   if( new_value != 0xff ) {
00098    // Now we know that some bits need to be programmed to '0' also.
00099 
00100    EEDR = new_value; // Set EEPROM data register.
00101    EECR = (1<<EEMPE) | // Set Master Write Enable bit...
00102           (0<<EEPM1) | (0<<EEPM0); // ...and Erase+Write mode.
00103    EECR |= (1<<EEPE);  // Start Erase+Write operation.
00104   } else {
00105    // Now we know that all bits should be erased.
00106 
00107    EECR = (1<<EEMPE) | // Set Master Write Enable bit...
00108           (1<<EEPM0);  // ...and Erase-only mode.
00109    EECR |= (1<<EEPE);  // Start Erase-only operation.
00110   }
00111  } else {
00112   // Now we know that _no_ bits need to be erased to '1'.
00113 
00114   // Check if any bits are changed from '1' in the old value.
00115   if( diff_mask ) {
00116    // Now we know that _some_ bits need to the programmed to '0'.
00117 
00118    EEDR = new_value;   // Set EEPROM data register.
00119    EECR = (1<<EEMPE) | // Set Master Write Enable bit...
00120           (1<<EEPM1);  // ...and Write-only mode.
00121    EECR |= (1<<EEPE);  // Start Write-only operation.
00122   }
00123  }
00124 
00125  sei(); // Restore interrupt flag state.
00126 }
00127 
00128 // Extensions added as part of Grbl

00130 
00131 void memcpy_to_eeprom_with_checksum(unsigned int destination, char *source, unsigned int size) {
00132   unsigned char checksum = 0;
00133   for(; size > 0; size--) {
00134     checksum = (checksum << 1) || (checksum >> 7);
00135     checksum += *source;
00136     eeprom_put_char(destination++, *(source++));
00137   }
00138   eeprom_put_char(destination, checksum);
00139 }
00140 
00141 int memcpy_from_eeprom_with_checksum(char *destination, unsigned int source, unsigned int size) {
00142   unsigned char data, checksum = 0;
00143   for(; size > 0; size--) {
00144     data = eeprom_get_char(source++);
00145     checksum = (checksum << 1) || (checksum >> 7);
00146     checksum += data;
00147     *(destination++) = data;
00148   }
00149   return(checksum == eeprom_get_char(source));
00150 }
